title: As a teacher, how do you write a leave application to the principal? - Quora

response.answer_text: Start out by saying how much you've enjoyed teaching at the school and how helpful the staff have been and kids are amazing. Then tell the principal what dates you'll be leaving and the date you'll be back, If you will be coming back. You want to let him know you've given it a lot of thought and feel at this time you need too stimulate yourself and trying new things that would revive you. I don't. Think I'd go into specific details unless he asked. Depending on the situation you might want to ask him to keep the notice to himself until you had a chance to put some things in order. Thank him for all the support he’s given you. I guess that's pretty much it.
